answerText: vector graphics[10] By contrast, raster graphics work by specifying information about each of these entities on a bitmap grid. Their three-dimensional analogues are called voxels, and on modern displays, each one is typically broken down into red, blue, and green subcomponents.

question: Question:  [10] Name this type of imagery. These images can be scaled without loss of resolution.
